title: Shows
content:
We started our adventure in showing goats a bit late in life! I took a short flight over to Idaho to see the Syringa Miniature Dairy goat Show in 2010 where I found my little unassuming buckling who became FMCH Echo Hill's Rio Bravo +*B the most significant addition to my herd in the 13 years I have been doing this. 
With my friend "Farm Boy" Eric we tried a local 4H club show and took our little herd over to Walla Walla for our first Wine Country Classic MDGA show. That was 11 years ago. Soon I partnered with our local All breed goat club to sponsor MDGA sho0ws on this side of the state. WHAT A LOT OF WORK! I have empathy and respect for all folks who volunteer and run goat shows! For several years I chaired shows on both sides of the mountains. Here are some of the results of our live show career that is ongoing. Most of the judges we have placed under have been ADGA trained and licensed. 
There are so few shows each year and coming to this late in life I am still, and always will be an amateur showwoman! And going forward will be both grateful for, and careful with my new titanium right shoulder!

## Virtual Shows
The MDGA Virtual show is another avenue we have participated in occaisionally to suplement live show opportunities. This show really does rely on accurate well posed goat photos, and we are still not very good at those, although Leslie and I are getting better. Doing a lot of goats, most who do not care for the excersize is sometimes frustrating, often hilarious! We had many great placings nearly always having a goat in first place in at least one age group, here we will highlight only those animals earning GCH/RGCH or BIS and some of the shows are missing in the archives at MDGA.
